debug ( $  type,
$  success,
$  message,
$  throwable = null 
)

Log a debug level security event if 'debug' level logging is enabled and also record the stack trace associated with the event.

Parameters:
type the type of event
success False indicates this was a failed event (the typical value). True indicates this was a successful event.
message the message to log
throwable the exception to be logged

Implements Log4PhpLogger.

isDebugEnabled (  ) 

Allows the caller to determine if messages logged at this level will be discarded, to avoid performing expensive processing.

Returns:
true if debug level messages will be output to the log

Implements Log4PhpLogger.

setLevel ( $  level  ) 

The SECURITY type of log event. The USABILITY type of log event. The PERFORMANCE type of log event. The FUNCTIONALITY type of log event. This is the type of event that non-security focused loggers typically log. If you are going to log your existing non-security events in the same log with your security events, you probably want to use this type of log event. OFF indicates that no messages should be logged. This level is initialized to Integer.MAX_VALUE. FATAL indicates that only FATAL messages should be logged. This level is initialized to 1000. ERROR indicates that ERROR messages and above should be logged. This level is initialized to 800. WARNING indicates that WARNING messages and above should be logged. This level is initialized to 600. INFO indicates that INFO messages and above should be logged. This level is initialized to 400. DEBUG indicates that DEBUG messages and above should be logged. This level is initialized to 200. TRACE indicates that TRACE messages and above should be logged. This level is initialized to 100. Dynamically set the logging severity level. All events of this level and higher will be logged from this point forward for all logs. All events below this level will be discarded.

Parameters:
level The level to set the logging level to.
Note: In this implementation, this change is not persistent, meaning that if the application is restarted, the log level will revert to the level defined in the ESAPI SecurityConfiguration properties file.

Implements Log4PhpLogger.
